page.title: 02FARMING LAND AT POLWARTH 1
page.content: ALTHOUGH THE PARISH OF POLWARTH IS BORDERED BY THE MOORLAND RISING TOWARDS THE LAMMERMUIRS, IT IS ON A SOUTH FACING SLOPE LEADING DOWN TOWARDS THE MERSE, THE VALLEY OF THE TWEED, & THE GROUND IS PRODUCTIVE. MOST OF THE AREA IS FARMED FROM WOODHEADS, AS MARCHMONT FARMS, WITH POLWARTH MILL (FARMED WITH CHOICELEE) EDGING THE AREA TO THE NORTH, & SISTERPATH ( RUN TOGETHER WITH COTHILL & WOODEND) EDGING IT IN THE SOUTH EAST. ALL ARE RUN AS ARBLE & SHEEP FARMS.MANY IMPROVEMENTS HAD BEEN IMPLEMENTED BY THE LANDOWNER, LORD MARCHMONT IN THE 18 CENTURY & CONSIDERABLE & ELABORATE DRAINAGE SYSTEMS HAD BEEN PUT IN IN THE EARLY 19 CENTURY BY HIS SUCCESSOR, SIR WM. PURVES HUME CAMPBELL. BUT FROM THE LATER 19 CENTURY FOR ABOUT 100 YEARS LESS PROGRESS WAS MADE.
